results.title: Alexander Turnbull's library
results.creator_credit: Paul Maunder, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The film takes the viewer through an ordinary day of the famous Alexander Turnbull Library showing glimpses of the treasures - rare books, New Zealand and Pacific collection, manuscripts and paintings. The viewer learns that the historic building is no longer safe, and is about to be destroyed for the construction of a motorway.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Maunder, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Alexander the Great and the Hellenistic Age
results.brief_description: Alexander’s campaigns and the spread of Greek culture are the focuses of this film. The flowering of commerce, art and science that was the Hellenistic Age is reflected in the views of Rhodes and Delas, Hellenistic sculpture, the Temple of Zeus and the archaeological treasures of Sidon Sarcophagus, the Issis mosaic and the ruins of Persepolis.
results.title_for_label: Alexander the Great and the Hellenistic Age

results.title: Alcohol and tobacco: what they do to our bodies
results.brief_description: Laboratory tests are used to show the effects of alcohol on the human body. A comparison is made of the skill and ability of a juggler and an athlete before and after smoking and drinking.

results.title: Al Maguire
results.brief_description: Head coach Al Maguire has made Marquette University’s Warriors one of the most potent forces in college basketball. Maguire sees fear as motivating his own success and that of many others- fear of returning to some unsatisfactory situation one has been in- fear of losing the rewards of the present to some unknown situation.

results.title: Air parade: a Shell film for the Festival of Britain 1951
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: A brief history of aviation in Britain commencing with Bleriot’s crossing of the Channel in 1909 and ending with the development of the gas-turbine airliner. This film traces the development of both military and civil aircraft including the Viscount turbo-jet and the Comet.

results.title: Agriculture in Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the highly organized and productive farming methods of Japan, a small, densely populated country where every available square foot of land is valued. Profiles rice planting and its cultivation, stressing the high quotient of manual labour used in Japanese agricultural methods. The different kinds of produce are clearly defined and their cultivation topically treated.

The different kinds of produce are clearly defined and their cultivation topically treated.

results.title: The Age of plywood
results.brief_description: The manufacture and uses of plywood. Every stage in the manufacture of plywood, from the journey of the log from the forest, its peeling or slicing into veneer, and processing to various grades of plywood. The uses of plywood in homes, commercial buildings and building projects, for panelling, furniture, structural work, concrete formwork and boat building.
results.description: The manufacture and uses of plywood. Every stage in the manufacture of plywood, from the journey of the log from the forest, its peeling or slicing into veneer, and processing to various grades of plywood. The uses of plywood in homes, commercial buildings and building projects, for panelling, furniture, structural work, concrete formwork and boat building.
description_for_label: The manufacture and uses of plywood. Every stage in the manufacture of plywood, from the journey of the log from the forest, its peeling or slicing into veneer, and processing to various grades of plywood. The uses of plywood in homes, commercial buildings and building projects, for panelling, furniture, structural work, concrete formwork and boat building.

results.title: Africa: the land and its people. No. 2
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Fruit and vegetable growing in the Union of South Africa for home use, export and canning. World famous archeologist L’Abbe Breuil at work among the Bushmen, a dwindling tribe of nomadic hunters who have left a history of primitive man in their cave paintings.

results.description: Magazine items: Fruit and vegetable growing in the Union of South Africa for home use, export and canning. World famous archeologist L’Abbe Breuil at work among the Bushmen, a dwindling tribe of nomadic hunters who have left a history of primitive man in their cave paintings.

results.title: Advertising
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Explores the structure of an advertising agency, looking at the roles of account executives, researchers, commercial artists, copywriters, photographers, production and media planners. By following the process of an advertising campaign, the skills and collaboration required within each section of an agency are highlighted.
